result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: No contact w/victim or their residence - MJB, except victim can visit him in prison.

10:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew C Brogan not in court.  Attorney Joseph Edward Long JD appeared by phone for Matthew C Brogan. 
Attorney Long requests to withdraw from the case. Court grants and this matter will be reset. Defendant in incarcerated.
Arraignment scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Motion and prop. order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
8:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew C Brogan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Edward Long JD in court for Matthew C Brogan. 
Officer Leigh is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being a Sergeant for the Wood County Sheriff's Department. Testifies to being dispatched to a residence for a disturbance. Testifies to the defendant fleeing the scene before the officers arrived. Testifies to MJB calling dispatch back when the defendant arrived back on scene. Testifies to going back to the scene and seeing the defendant running through a field. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to the defendant running from the scene when they came back.

Attorney Long questions the defendant. Defendant is still under Oath and testifies.
Defendant testifies to not being in distress. Testifies to the going to MJB's to get clothes. 

Bond is continued.

Court takes judicial notice of other cases.

Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bond is continued. This matter will be set for a competency evaluation.
Arraignment scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No contact with victim or their residence - MJB. $5000
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact w/victim or their residence - MJB.

2:08 PM Defendant Matthew C Brogan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Edward Long JD in court for Matthew C Brogan.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment. Attorney Long makes a statement regarding bond. Bond is set.
